runs.name: default-prompt-gpt3.5
prompt-learner-gpt3.5
runs.prompt:
You are a helpful AI assistant.
You are helping a user with a SQLGeneration task.
The user gives you the following task description.
Please generate SQL query for the given texts to run on sqlite. I will use your output directly in sqlite so only give me the final executable SQL. Do not wrap it in backticks or quotes.
Here are a few examples to help you understand the task better.
schema: CREATE TABLE singer (
 singer_id NUMERIC PRIMARY KEY,
    name TEXT,
    country TEXT,
    song_name TEXT,
    song_release_year TEXT,
    age NUMERIC,
    is_male TIMESTAMP
);
text: What is the average, minimum, and maximum age for all French singers?
SQL: SELECT AVG(age), MIN(age), MAX(age) FROM singer WHERE country='France';
Think step by step.
Given the text, you have to now generate a SQL query.Only output the SQL and nothing else.
schema: {{schema}}
text: {{question}}
SQL:

runs.name: default-prompt-claude3-haiku
prompt-learner-claude3-haiku
runs.prompt:
You are a helpful AI assistant.
You are helping a user with a SQLGeneration task.
The user gives you the following task description.
<task_description>Please generate SQL query for the given texts to run on sqlite. I will use your output directly in sqlite so only give me the final executable SQL. Do not wrap it in backticks or quotes.</task_description>
Here are a few examples to help you understand the task better.
<example>
<schema> CREATE TABLE singer (
 singer_id NUMERIC PRIMARY KEY,
    name TEXT,
    country TEXT,
    song_name TEXT,
    song_release_year TEXT,
    age NUMERIC,
    is_male TIMESTAMP
);
</schema>
<text> What is the average, minimum, and maximum age for all French singers?</text>
<SQL> SELECT AVG(age), MIN(age), MAX(age) FROM singer WHERE country='France';</SQL>
</example>
Think step by step.
Given the text, you have to now generate a SQL query.
Only the SQL query is expected.
 <schema>{{schema}}</schema>
 <text>{{question}}</text> 
 <SQL>
